item.title: How To Afford A New AC Installation
item.dc:creator: reese99
item.content:encoded:
As a homeowner, you may be at that point in your homeowner’s journey where your air conditioner has come to the end of its life. You probably reviewed the cost to replace a furnace and AC and now wonder if you’ll ever afford it. Whether you need to replace just the furnace or only the AC, or other parts of your HVAC system, you will need to understand those costs and how to finance the cost.

What Is The Cost To Replace A Furnace and AC?

In Houston, HVAC replacement costs vary between $1000-$4000 for a new air conditioning system. Here are some factors that affect the total price of a new AC installation:

Central Air Conditioning vs. Ductless Mini Split

The first major factor in price comparisons of air conditioning units is in the type of unit you choose. You must weigh the advantages and disadvantages of both systems and determine which unit will serve you better. Central air conditioners usually cost more in the Houston HVAC industry.

Duct Replacement In Houston

The cost of your AC will also depend on whether you are in need of a duct system to be installed or renovated.  Your Air Co. provides the best ductwork in Houston, TX and at a fair price.

Size Of Your AC or Furnace Unit

The cost to replace a furnace and AC will also depend on its size. The size of the unit will need to be big enough to accommodate the square footage of your home.

Financing Options For Your New AC Unit

Now that we understand some of the factors that play in the price of Houston HVAC installation services, we are still left with the question of how to afford these costs. Your Air Co. now offers several financing options to make HVAC purchases affordable and accessible for everyone. We have collaborated with the following financial institutions:
  • Square - offers a credit card financing and an easy payment system
  • Foundation Finance - offers a low interest rate and quick approvals
  • Castle Credit - is willing to work with you to arrange feasible payment plan
  • Okinus - offers a least to own financing option at an affordable to rate
Whether you need a duct replacement in Houston, TX or a whole new HVAC system, we have the financing options available to you to help you live comfortably in your home.

Benefits Of Financing AC Unit Installation

We receive many of the same questions when it comes to financing the cost to replace a furnace and AC. Many of these inquiries fall under the same category that explores the benefits of financing an HVAC purchase which are outlined below.

Quick Approvals

Due to the relationships we fostered with our financial partners, the approval process is very quick and painless. Your application will be reviewed and decided upon within 1-2 business days. This will allow you to enjoy an air conditioned home quicker.

Affordable Payments

In Houston, HVAC systems break down more often in the summer months or in the depths of winter. Incidentally, this is also the time when people are least prepared for the financial burden of a new air conditioning unit. The financing options at Your Air Co. make it affordable for you at any time of the year.

We Will Work With Your Credit Score

We understand that we live in a tough economic climate of inflation and increased prices. These factors affect credit scores. Regardless of your credit score, we will find a financing option that is suited for your needs.

Convenient Repayment Methods

Financing the cost to replace a furnace and AC doesn’t have to be difficult and made sure of that by arranging a convenient and affordable method of repayment. Our electronic portals are easy to use and navigate.

Do You Need a New HVAC System?

Whether you need to replace your entire HVAC system or just certains parts of it, Your Air Co. provides optimal financing options. Contact us today by calling (832) 2444-9464 or request financing information on our website. In Houston, HVAC units are essential and we offer the highest quality installation and repair services at reasonable rates.

item.title: When To Call An Air Conditioning Repair Service In Houston
item.dc:creator: reese99
item.content:encoded:
Air conditioning units are a necessary amenity in a warm climate such as Houston’s. Without a properly working AC, we are bound to have a downright miserable summer. To avoid such a predicament, we rounded up some of the common signs that indicate that it's time for a visit from an air conditioning repair tech in Houston. Read on to be prepared to troubleshoot your AC challenges.

Odd Smells Coming From The AC Vents

Odd smells coming from the vents are explained by several causes and each one of them requires proper attention. If you smell something burning coming from the vents, turn off the AC immediately and call your local air conditioning service in Houston. Burning may be caused by a motor that’s caught on fire, which can spread and cause irreparable damage. Strange odors can also be caused by something dead or decomposed in the outdoor unit, or an accumulation of debris. Depending on what it is, it will cause a terrible smell in the home. For this reason, it is important to have a bi-annual maintenance inspection from an air conditioning service in Houston.

Water Leaks From Unit Or Vents

Water leaks coming from the unit or vents is a terrible sign. This problem will need to be addressed as soon as it comes to light because it can cause great, costly damage. Water can cause structural damage and will lead to mold. A tech from an air conditioning service in Houston, such as Your Air Co., will determine the cause of the water leak. It can be a result of refrigerant fluid leaks or a problem with the evaporator’s inability to circulate air correctly. Regardless of the cause, you will need an expert from an air conditioning repair service to help you out with this problem.

Poor Airflow

Poor airflow really beats the purpose of having an air conditioning unit. This issue can be caused by something simple like a clogged air filter or something more complicated like a broken blow motor or an issue with the ducts. Poor airflow will result in your AC working harder to produce cool air and will eventually lead to it breaking down. If you’re experiencing this issue, contact your local air conditioning repair in Houston, YourAir Co. to fix the problem.

Increasing Energy Bills 

Have you noticed your energy bills increasing in price even though your usage hasn’t increased? This may be caused by an inefficient air conditioning system. Here are some common reasons why your AC may inefficient:

The Unit Is Too Small

Your air conditioning unit has to be correctly sized to accommodate the size of your home efficiently. If it is too small, it will be harder to cool your home. This will bring a spike in your energy bills over time and require extra repairs and early replacement. Consult your local air conditioning service in Houston about the required AC unit size for your home.

Clogged Air Filters

Clogged air filters prevent proper airflow which will cause the unit to work harder to produce the same energy. Though cleaning and replacing filters is simple to do on your own, if it isn't done regularly, your AC will end up using more energy than necessary. It will also break and wear out faster. We recommend checking your air filters at least once a month as you complete your regular cleaning chores.

The AC Unit Is Too Old

The age of your air conditioning unit has a great impact on its efficiency. The older the unit gets, the harder it has to work to produce the same energy. Your energy bills will increase as a result and cost you a lot of money. Additionally, old AC units will require you to call the air conditioning repair service in Houston more often as it will begin to break down more frequently.

Do you think your AC is in need of some TLC?

If your home is experiencing some of these aforementioned issues with the air conditioning unit, do not hesitate to contact Your Air Co. for the top air conditioning repair in Houston. We are committed to providing excellence and 24-hour emergency service to help you enjoy the comforts of your home. Call us today at  (832) 244-9464.

item.title: Top Reasons to Call an HVAC Contractor In Houston
item.dc:creator: reese99
item.content:encoded:
Summers are downright hot in Houston and seem to be getting more so every year. An AC breakdown is never something you want to contend with. You rely on your HVAC system for cooling and heating throughout the year. It’s a complex series of equipment, ducts, and connections that all must work correctly to keep your home comfortable, efficient, and safe. Emergencies and expensive repairs can result if you wait for service. To help you save, we’ll reveal the top reasons to call an HVAC contractor in Houston. Aside from your AC or heater not running, here are reasons to call YourAir Co., starting with some symptoms (we’ll detail additional perks later):
  • Loud Noise: Any changes in how your HVAC system sounds is a reason to call for help. Banging, screeching, popping, pinging, and knocking are a few noises of concern. They can mean your AC has a loose belt, broken part, or possibly a duct or vent clog.
  • Leak: If the system is leaking water, the condensate drain may be clogged. Water damage and mold can occur. A Freon or oil leak can cause serious damage and be a danger to your family. Call an HVAC contractor right away.
  • Poor Temperature Control: If it’s too hot or too cool despite the thermostat setting, there could be a serious problem. Significantly different temperatures from room to room is also a cause for concern.
  • Lack of Humidity Control: If it’s too humid or too dry in your home, it can be hard to stay comfortable. It may also mean that your HVAC system has a leak or there is a sealing issue with your ventilation system.
  • Higher Bills: A spike in your utility bill can be a direct indicator of your HVAC system’s condition. Air leaks, clogs, and malfunctioning components cause the system to burn more energy, increasing monthly operating costs.

Advantages of Calling a Local HVAC Contractor Immediately

Our residential, commercial, and industrial clients all benefit in the same ways by calling for HVAC service. The top reasons to call an HVAC contractor in Houston include:
  • The problem will be troubleshooted, diagnosed, and fixed quickly and correctly. Our trained technicians fix it right the first time no matter the scope of the problem or type of equipment involved.
  • Your safety is ensured as licensed contractors have the training, tools, and equipment to deal with complex HVAC components, fuel lines, emission ventilation, electricity, and other potential hazards.
  • A professional technician will perform maintenance to ensure there are no hidden problems like dirty/clogged ducts, blower issues, low refrigerant, etc. Addressing any minor concerns can avoid another repair job later.
  • HVAC contractors check for pollutants including dust and pollen, as well as dirty filters. Removing pollutants and replacing old filters will improve indoor air quality in your home or business.
  • Our professionals provide excellent customer service and are trained at our own trade school. Clients always receive personalized attention. Our technicians adhere to our commitment to excellence and providing unmatched service.

Contact YourAir Co.

Known for excellent HVAC repair and replacement services in Houston, TX, our team provides 24-hour service and a one-year 100% money-back guarantee. We also provide ductwork and air quality services, plus repair estimates when closing on a client’s home. Your budget is considered with every job and financing options are available to make payments affordable. For more information or a free quote, call 832-244-9464 today.

  • HVAC contractors check for pollutants including dust and pollen, as well as dirty filters. Removing pollutants and replacing old filters will improve indoor air quality in your home or business.
  • Our professionals provide excellent customer service and are trained at our own trade school. Clients always receive personalized attention. Our technicians adhere to our commitment to excellence and providing unmatched service.

item.title: Common Air Conditioning Problems
item.dc:creator: reese99
item.content:encoded:
Houston summers are very hot and the only thing that makes them bearable is an air conditioned room. Air conditioning is great until it begins to develop problems that most people don’t know how to address. Below we outline some of the most common problems that would require air conditioning repair in Houston, TX.

There Is No Air Flow

Lack of air flow coming from the vents kind of beats the purpose of having an air conditioner, doesn’t it? It is also a very frustrating problem on a hot day. There are several causes of airflow issues in the HVAC system but the top three are clogged air filters, incorrectly sized air conditioning units, and too much dirt in the outdoor unit. Any of these issues can result in the need for emergency AC repair in Houston on a hot day.

Clogged Air Filters

Clogged air filters are one of the simpler issues that most homeowners can fix on their own. Over time, air filters accumulate dust and debris and prevent the circulation of air. We recommend checking your filters every 4-6 weeks, depending on how often you use your air conditioning.

Incorrectly Sized Air Conditioning Unit

In order for your air conditioning unit to produce enough cool air, it must be appropriately sized for the square footage of your home. If your AC is too small, not only will it produce a low air flow but also work harder to cool a room. Your energy bills will be sky-high and it will wear out faster. Your Air Co. offers 24 hour AC repair in Houston, TX and we offer the best HVAC experts who will determine the cause of your air flow issues.

Too Much Dirt In The Outdoor Unit

The area around the outdoor unit often gets forgotten. Dirt and debris may end up getting stuck in the vents of the unit, preventing proper air flow. The accumulation of dirt will lead to your unit overheating, breaking down and necessitating you to call a technician for air conditioning repair in Houston. To avoid this issue, we recommend keeping the area around your AC unit clean and to keep up with your annual maintenance checks.

Bad Odor Coming From Vents

A perfectly working air conditioning unit can easily be marred by poor odor coming from the vents. Most commonly, bad odor is caused by clogged air filters, ducts, and the development of mold in your AC unit. If you sense the smell of mold or fire coming from the vents, please be advised that this issue needs to be addressed immediately. Your Air Co. offers emergency AC repair in Houston and is available 24/7 for such issues. Mold contributes to many health hazards, while the smell of fire is often a sign of a burning motor in the unit. Both problems will lead to irreparable damages if not addressed properly and by a specialist.

Loud When Operating

When an air conditioning unit is loud while operating, it may signify that AC repair is needed. It may be the result of loose belts, faulty motors, or debris being stuck in the ducts and vents. If the noise is increasing, contact your local air conditioning repair tech in Houston for help.

Poor Air Quality

Do you feel like you're breathing dust when your AC is working? Or perhaps it feels stuffy all the time, despite the AC working. These concerns are very common alongside the poor odor that we discussed earlier. Ensuring optimized air quality in your home is very essential, especially for those who suffer with upper respiratory challenges like asthma and allergies. An air conditioning repair tech in Houston would be able to assist you with improving the air quality in your home.

It’s Not Turning On

There are various reasons for why your AC unit may not be turning on. One of the most common reasons, however, is that the thermostat’s batteries need replacement. If the batteries have been replaced and the AC is still not working, there may be a bigger issue with the thermostat or a broken motor. You may need an emergency AC repair service in Houston to solve this problem. By the way, did you know that a programmable thermostat can help save money on your energy bills? Ask your air conditioning repair tech to learn more about these smart thermostats.

Are You Experiencing One or More of these Air Conditioning Problems?

Contact Your Air Co. today for the best service in air conditioning repair in Houston, TX. Our technicians are equipped with the latest technology, experience, and training to help you enjoy the best summer in Houston, TX.

item.title: Signs You Need An AC Replacement
item.dc:creator: reese99
item.content:encoded:
Air conditioners are an excellent modern convenience that make the summers in Houston all that bearable. That is, until they begin to show signs of a needed replacement. If you're a homeowner, you may wonder what these signs mean and when you should replace your air conditioner. Below, the top HVAC contractors in Houston from YourAir Co. outlined these top signs.

It's Approaching The End Of Its Lifespan

Nothing lasts forever, including HVAC systems. Most air conditioner units have a lifespan of about 15-20 years. This makes them a worthwhile investment. If an HVAC in Houston is properly maintained, it will last you at least until your kids are out of high school. As the AC ages, the production of cool air will not be the same. You will find yourself having to turn up the HVAC more often than before to cool off.

Increasing Energy Bills

Most HVAC contractors in Houston will agree that increasing energy bills without an increase in your energy use warrants an HVAC inspection at the very least. If your energy bills are increasing, this may mean that your air conditioning system isn’t working as efficiently anymore. As mentioned above, the age of your HVAC system has a lot do with how efficiently it cools your home. Additionally, a regular maintenance visit from the best Houston’s HVAC service techs, YourAir Co., will help keep your unit at optimal performance. The lack of efficiency can be caused by the following factors:
  • Clogged air filters that prevent proper air circulation
  • Inconsistent room temperature caused by open windows and doors while the AC is working
  • Broken blow motor
  • Low levels of refrigerant fluid
These are all causes of an air conditioner’s poor efficiency and would have to be checked out by a technician specializing in HVAC in Houston.

Excessive Repairs

As an air conditioning unit ages, you will notice an increase in needed repairs. This is a very normal part of the aging process for almost anything in life. Parts wear out, requiring replacement more frequently. After several repairs, it may be time to consider replacing the AC which will be cheaper than paying for endless repairs on a unit that has come to the end of its life. Houston’s HVAC technicians provided by YourAir Co. have the expertise to provide you with the advice regarding the excessive repairs of your AC. While some repairs will prolong the use of your HVAC unit, it is important to remember the types of issues that will automatically deem your unit inoperational:
  • The blow motor burned out, and this is often manifested by a “burning” smell coming from the vents followed by a system shut down
  • AC refrigerant leaks which are hazardous
  • Frozen evaporator coils
  • Failure in the electrical connections of the unit
If any of these issues present themselves in your home, don’t hesitate to contact an HVAC contractor in Houston right away.

Too Loud When Operating

As an air conditioning unit ages, it also begins to operate louder and louder. While simple repairs can often solve the issue, sometimes replacing the entire HVAC unit will be more economical. Here are the following sounds to listen for in your HVAC system:
  • Hissing - is most often heard when there is a leak of refrigerant fluid
  • Clicking - when the AC is turned on and off, which indicated a relay issue
  • Thumping, rattling, banging - blower or motor may be loose or broken
  • Screeching - often caused by issues witht he compressor or fan motor
  • Buzzing - caused by issues with electrical components
At the very least, these sounds would need to be properly investigated by an HVAC contractor in Houston to determine their cause. While some issues can be repaired, when it comes to leaks and faulty electrical systems, a replacement may be warranted. Are you experiencing any of these issues with your air conditioning unit? YourAir Co. is the top HVAC contractor in Houston and is here to help you with your HVAC needs. Let us know how we can help you live your best life throughout the hot summer months of Houston, TX. Call us today at (832) 244-9464 for top rated and efficient service.

item.title: How To Prepare Your Furnace For Fall
item.dc:creator: reese99
item.content:encoded:
This year is flying by quickly and it is now time to think ahead to the upcoming fall season. You may already be in the midst of fall preparations as you get the kids’ school supplies in order and prepare your home for the end of summer. As you go about completing these essential tasks, here are some vital things to do to ensure your furnace is ready for fall. These tasks range from a simple check to contacting your local air conditioner repair in Houston.

Check Your Air Filters

One of the simplest tasks you can do to prepare your furnace for fall is to check your air filters. Let’s face it, it gets pretty hot in Houston through the summer months and by the time fall rolls around, your AC has put in many hours of work to cool your home. Constant AC operation produces an accumulation of dust and debris. This results in poor air circulation and low HVAC efficiency. Clogged air filters also decrease the air quality within your home. A quick check of those filters will help ensure that you and your loved ones breathe the cleanest and most optimal air. As the top experts in air conditioning and furnace service in Houston, TX, YourAir Co. provides superb air quality services that will improve your indoor air quality.

Seal Air Leaks

Air leaks are another common concern in HVAC systems that need to be checked for regularly. Air leaks decrease the efficiency of your unit, causing it to work harder without actually contributing to the change of the home’s temperatures. In order to seal these air leaks, you must first be able to locate them. This may not be a simple task, especially if AC repair isn’t your specialty. We encourage you to reach out to an air conditioner repair tech in Houston for a leak detection.

Clean Area Around Outdoor Unit

The outdoor area around the HVAC unit tends to get cluttered with toys, fallen leaves, and other items. As you prepare for the fall months, take the time to clean up that area. Pick up any toys, sweep or rake up leaves, and ensure that it is free of all debris. Also, make sure that nothing is placed on top of the unit as this does affect its function. Skipping this task isn’t recommended because debris gets trapped in the vents of the AC. Debris that gets stuck in the unit will decompose and alter the quality of the air traveling through your home. You may notice a foul smell or a lack of airflow. This simple maintenance step will ensure a comfortable fall season and prevent extra air conditioning repairs in Houston.

Check On Your Alarms, Detectors, And Thermostat

Another simple step to take to prepare your home for the fall is to check your alarms, detectors, and thermostat. Make sure that each unit you check has a fresh set of batteries. This will help you stay within the Fire Marshal’s code and recommendations. If your thermostat is programmable, this is also a good time to ensure that it is programmed to your preferred temperatures. If you’re unsure of how to do this, a furnace service tech in Houston, TX will be able to assist you with completing this step.

Schedule A Maintenance Checkup

One of the best things you could do to prepare your home for fall is to schedule a maintenance checkup with an air conditioning repair tech in Houston, TX. The following factors are benefits of a regular maintenance check up:
  • Early detection of needed repairs before they cause greater and more costly issues
  • Clean air filters, ducts, and coils
  • Topped off refrigerant fluid levels
  • Prolonged life of your HVAC unit
  • The technician will ensure that the unit is correctly calibrated for efficient function
Clearly, a maintenance check will help mitigate extra headaches throughout the colder months of the year. Not only will the furnace service tech in Houston, TX help detect possible problems, but also help you enjoy your fall season to the fullest.

Does Your Furnace Need Maintenance?

When was the last time your furnace and air conditioner got a thorough maintenance inspection? Contact YouAir Co, the best air conditioning and furnace service in Houston, TX at (832) 244-9464 today or visit our website to set up your appointment.

item.title: 5 Ways To Improve Indoor Air Quality
item.dc:creator: reese99
item.content:encoded:
According to the United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), Americans spend an average of 90% of their time indoors. Thus, indoor air quality is extremely important. It not only ensures a comfortable and pleasant-smelling home, but it also helps us stay safe and healthy. In Houston, TX, air quality inside the home can be compromised by a variety of factors. There are numerous actions you can take to support the indoor air quality of your home and we outlined the top five actions below.

Change Your AC Filters

When was the last time you checked your air filters? Summers in Houston are hot and we tend to use our AC units all season long. Because of this, air filters accumulate more dust and debris. This dust and debris then travels through the vents and decreases indoor air quality. Most AC co77mpanies in Houston like YourAir Co. check and change air filters as part of their AC maintenance inspection service. Not only does this action increase air quality, but it also prolongs the life of your AC and helps it stay efficient.

Keep Humidity Levels At A Minimum

While part of the air conditioner’s job is to remove humidity inside the home, a little extra support never hurt. Investing in a humidifier will help you ensure that humidity levels are at a minimum. In Houston, TX, air quality is often affected by humidity as it is in a humid climate. Excess humidity in the home not only decreases your ability to breathe well, but it also leads to mold. When mold begins to spread, it can easily turn the most beautiful home into a disaster. Untreated mold leads to structural damage and is a great hazard to the health of everyone inside. It will lead to migraines, brain fog, and respiratory issues. To avoid this disaster, make sure to maintain your humidity levels between 30-50%.

Open Your Doors And Windows

Make sure to open the doors and windows when it is relatively cooler outside. Before the heat of the day or in the evening when it is cooler, open the doors and windows allowing the outside air filter in. This will bring in fresh air that will circulate throughout your home. It will bring in natural levels of oxygen and freshen up the overall environment. On a side note, to avoid unnecessary HVAC repairs in Houston, make sure you turn off your AC unit before inviting in outside air. If you don’t turn it off, the unit will work harder to maintain the preset temperatures of the home. This will wear out the system and require a visit from a technician from one of the local AC companies in Houston.

Clean Your Floors

Whether your floors are lined with hardwood, tile, or carpet, they all tend to be a breeding space for dust and dirt. That dust and dirt filters into the air and decreases its quality. Furthermore, if spills aren’t cleaned up in a timely manner, they can cause the floor to bubble and develop mold. As advised by Harvard Health, run a vacuum cleaner that is equipped with a HEPA filter at least once or twice a week. While you’re at it, make sure that any vents installed along the floor aren’t obstructed from circulating air throughout the house. If you have it in your budget, switch out carpet for hardwood flooring as it is easier to clean and will decrease the amount of allergens. Unsure of where to start? Contact a local expert in Houston, TX on air quality like YourAir Co., who will give you advice specifically tailored to your home.

Invest In An Air Purifier

An air purification system will make a great difference in the air quality inside your home. The Air Knight Reme offered by YourAirCo. is one of the industry’s leading air purification systems.  AC companies in Houston love this system because it is installed within the HVAC system, promoting the most optimal air inside the home. This system reduces indoor odors and pollutants, as well as bacteria, mold, and smoke.

What’s the Indoor Air Quality In Your home?

Contact YourAirCo. today for an air quality test and a consultation. Our air quality experts are ready to provide you with the advice and resources needed to create a healthy, breathing environment in your home. Fill out our online request form or call us at (832) 244-9464.

item.title: What Does It Cost to Replace a Furnace and AC Together?
item.dc:creator: reese99
item.content:encoded:
If you can afford it, most HVAC experts recommend replacing a furnace and AC together. HomeAdvisor puts the 2022 cost of furnace replacement at $1,000 to $4,000 and the cost of an air conditioner unit at $1,500 to $8,000. This means you’re likely to spend at least $2,500 to over $12,000 for a new HVAC system. Continue reading to learn more about the cost of replacing a furnace and AC together.

You Can Save by Installing Both

A contractor may offer a deal by installing both appliances at the same time. There may be additional labor and travel costs if they must visit at different times to install an air conditioner and then later a furnace. Other reasons you might save include:
  • Matched components work together to maximize efficiency.
  • Repairs to both systems are under warranty.
  • Newer systems generally require fewer repairs.
  • The installation process is less complicated.
  • Both units can share the same air handler/blower.
However, replacing both an AC and furnace may not be necessary, or cost-effective, if your system is relatively new. The general rule is that if a repair will cost over half the price of a new system, replacement is more cost-effective. There’s often a decision-making process between you and your HVAC contractor when it comes to repair or replacement (unless your system has completely failed).

What Affects the Cost of Replacing a Furnace and AC Together?

When you replace your heating and cooling units at the same time, these are some factors that can impact the cost of the project:
  • Type of System: Split systems generally cost in the $3,800 to $7,500 range compared to duct-free systems, which run from $2,000 to $14,500, and hybrid systems, which go from $2,500 to $10,000, according to Angi.
  • Size: A new HVAC system generally costs $25 to $60 per square foot to install. A heat pump is usually in the lower end of this range. For a 1,500 square foot home, expect to spend $4,000 to $7,000 but for a 3,000 square foot home, the cost will run from $7,000 to $12,000.
  • Brand: The brand of AC and furnace you choose can have a big impact on price. Units from Trane and York tend to be on the high end. However, you could spend significantly less on a system from Amana, Coleman, Bryant, or Rheem.
  • Efficiency Rating: Seasonal Energy Efficiency Ratio (SEER), which measures the energy an HVAC unit uses compared to its cooling load, depends on where you live. Higher SEER units can cost $1,000 to $2,000 more than an average system.
  • HVAC Contractor: Labor, according to Bob Vila, can cost anywhere from $500 to $2,500. New HVAC systems take between 6 and 10 hours to install. Labor charges vary from company to company, so make sure your contractor includes labor in its quote so you can make comparisons. The company will also charge for the removal and disposal of your existing system.

Additional Considerations

There are even more things to consider when budgeting for a new HVAC system. In addition to the furnace, AC unit, and labor, you’ll also need to think about:
  • Ductwork: At about $10 to $20 per linear foot, replacing HVAC ducts generally costs from $500 to $2,000.
  • Time of Purchase: If you have the option to wait, try purchasing your new AC in the fall, when demand is lower. Furnaces tend to drop in price by spring when it’s warmer.
  • Home Value: If you have newer, well-maintained, compatible heating and cooling systems, replacing both at the same time can add value to your home.
  • Climate: The cost of HVAC unit replacement is affected by climate. Depending on how warm or cool your area tends to be, you may need a furnace between 35,000 and 100,000 British Thermal Units (BTUs). Add 10% in BTU output for cooling if you live in a hot climate. For homes in dry areas, adding a humidifier is a cost factor to consider.
  • Asbestos Removal: If you have an older home, HVAC replacement may involve asbestos removal, for which you may need a licensed professional. The cost typically ranges from $500 to $1,000.
  • Insulation: While not part of your HVAC system, insulation affects comfort, performance, and efficiency; expect to spend $1,000 to $2,100 extra to update your insulation (but there can be a 10% to 15% reduction in heating/cooling costs).
Add-ons and upgrades can increase the overall cost by thousands of dollars. Adding equipment, labor, and time to the project, these extras can include installing a zone system, UV air purifying system, variable speed fan, or whole-house humidifier.

Contact Your Air Co.

Our team provides high-quality, 24/7 HVAC repair throughout the Houston area. When it’s time to replace your furnace and AC together, we’ll find the right equipment for your home, and ensure it receives preventative maintenance. We also provide ductwork and air quality services. Several financing options are available depending on your needs. To learn more about what we do and how we can help, call 832-244-9464.

"},"elements":[],"widgetType":"text-editor"},{"id":"20e471a","elType":"widget","settings":{"title":"Additional Considerations","header_size":"h3","title_color":"#000000","typography_typography":"custom","typography_font_family":"Roboto","typography_font_weight":"700","_padding":{"unit":"px","top":"20","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":false}},"elements":[],"widgetType":"heading"},{"id":"b2a5de0","elType":"widget","settings":{"editor":"There are even more things to consider when budgeting for a new HVAC system. In addition to the furnace, AC unit, and labor, you’ll also need to think about:
  • Ductwork: At about $10 to $20 per linear foot, replacing HVAC ducts generally costs from $500 to $2,000.
  • Time of Purchase: If you have the option to wait, try purchasing your new AC in the fall, when demand is lower. Furnaces tend to drop in price by spring when it’s warmer.
  • Home Value: If you have newer, well-maintained, compatible heating and cooling systems, replacing both at the same time can add value to your home.
  • Climate: The cost of HVAC unit replacement is affected by climate. Depending on how warm or cool your area tends to be, you may need a furnace between 35,000 and 100,000 British Thermal Units (BTUs). Add 10% in BTU output for cooling if you live in a hot climate. For homes in dry areas, adding a humidifier is a cost factor to consider.
  • Asbestos Removal: If you have an older home, HVAC replacement may involve asbestos removal, for which you may need a licensed professional. The cost typically ranges from $500 to $1,000.
  • Insulation: While not part of your HVAC system, insulation affects comfort, performance, and efficiency; expect to spend $1,000 to $2,100 extra to update your insulation (but there can be a 10% to 15% reduction in heating/cooling costs).
Add-ons and upgrades can increase the overall cost by thousands of dollars. Adding equipment, labor, and time to the project, these extras can include installing a zone system, UV air purifying system, variable speed fan, or whole-house humidifier."},"elements":[],"widgetType":"text-editor"},{"id":"bd667fb","elType":"widget","settings":{"title":"Contact Your Air Co.","header_size":"h3","title_color":"#000000","typography_typography":"custom","typography_font_family":"Roboto","typography_font_weight":"700","_padding":{"unit":"px","top":"20","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":false},"align":"center"},"elements":[],"widgetType":"heading"},{"id":"c7afcf3","elType":"widget","settings":{"editor":"
